businessProfile.name: Baldarotta's Porketta & Sicilian Sausage
businessProfile.address: 208 W Griggs St, Urbana, IL 61801, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 208 W Griggs St, Urbana, IL 61801, USA

reviews.text: Super yummy! The cold cut classic was a great and flavorful sandwich. My friends also enjoyed the parmesan chicken sandwich. The pickles were a nice touch but a little more sour than some expected.

First time here, not from the area & it took a bit to figure out where to park - in back.  We each had different sandwiches, 1 chips, 2 drinks: $41.  Both were signature sandwiches & both were very good.  Drinks are can/bottle from the cooler so no refills. Overall, the food outweighed the negatives for 5 stars.

The food was wonderful and filling! Absolutely recommend! The lemon-pecorino fries were spot-on and the Basil-pesto tortellini is one of my favorites! My husband and I shared a porketta, a sicilian sausage, the tortellini, the fries, a coke. We also had a coupon! We had food left over to take home! So, good!
Definitely the BEST sandwich in town. I have tried the Della and Pesto Ham. The flavor was spot on. The bread itself was herby and had a nice chew. The portion is great for the price

My son found this place.  What a gem! They serve Sicilian Deli sandwiches here that are outstanding. I had the Porketta sandwich with tender slices of pork loin marinated and piled high with baby spinach leaves and pepper salad. It was great. My wife had the Sicilian Sausage sandwich with a spicy red sauce. My son tried the Baldorata, which was a combo of both, and the Muffaletta sandwich made with real Pistachio Mortadella. It will be my place in Champaign.
Another plus is the 25 O'clock brewery right next door!! They serve an eclectic variety of beers, with homemade ginger ale for the kiddies. Benches and board games, free pool and darts, and you can order any food from Baldarotta's next door, and they will deliver it to for free. Great Combo spot for great food and great beer.
Located just east of route 45. On Griggs street, a block south of University Drive.

recentReviews.text: I have been to this place twice now and they will continue to get my business. Everything I have gotten has been delicious! Their sandwiches are loaded and their salads are fresh and packed with flavor.
Best sandwiches in CU by a mile. This is the one place I don't have a "usual" order. Everything I've had has been delicious.
I had the porketta and my partner had the sicicillian sausage sandwich. Both were amazing experiences. Good portions and what feels like artisinal quality for a comparable price.

Amazing! Fast and friendly service, nice music playing, and the food was SO GOOD. We had the porketta and the Calabrian and hot honey wings. Both were fresh, flavorful, and filling! One of the best sandwiches I‚Äôve ever had üòç
The best Italian beef around. Great customer service. Ev and Paris are great. Try the gelato!
Had the Baldarotta and Spumoni. Both were delicious.  Excellent customer service.

It‚Äôs bussin fr only had the Italian beef but I‚Äôd definitely go back and it‚Äôs chill in there and I don‚Äôt even leave food reviews but I felt like I had to do a review because of how great the food was no cap
I had the porketta sandwich. It was so delicious, some of the best pork I have had!

detailedReviews.author: Tim
detailedReviews.text: I have been to this place twice now and they will continue to get my business. Everything I have gotten has been delicious! Their sandwiches are loaded and their salads are fresh and packed with flavor.

detailedReviews.author: Matthew Hiser
detailedReviews.text: Best sandwiches in CU by a mile. This is the one place I don't have a "usual" order. Everything I've had has been delicious.

detailedReviews.author: Dale Gentry
detailedReviews.text: Awsome Italian place

detailedReviews.author: Tom Kirkwood
detailedReviews.text: I had the porketta and my partner had the sicicillian sausage sandwich. Both were amazing experiences. Good portions and what feels like artisinal quality for a comparable price.

detailedReviews.author: Lane Kress
detailedReviews.text: Absolutely delicious.

detailedReviews.author: Ashley H
detailedReviews.text: Amazing! Fast and friendly service, nice music playing, and the food was SO GOOD. We had the porketta and the Calabrian and hot honey wings. Both were fresh, flavorful, and filling! One of the best sandwiches I‚Äôve ever had üòç

detailedReviews.author: Don VanLiew
detailedReviews.text: The best Italian beef around. Great customer service. Ev and Paris are great. Try the gelato!

detailedReviews.author: Lisa OConnor
detailedReviews.text: Had the Baldarotta and Spumoni. Both were delicious.  Excellent customer service.

detailedReviews.author: Devante Perkins
detailedReviews.text: It‚Äôs bussin fr only had the Italian beef but I‚Äôd definitely go back and it‚Äôs chill in there and I don‚Äôt even leave food reviews but I felt like I had to do a review because of how great the food was no cap

detailedReviews.author: jordan whalen
detailedReviews.text: I had the porketta sandwich. It was so delicious, some of the best pork I have had!

detailedReviews.author: Lori Flynn
detailedReviews.text: The food makes the poor customer service worthwhile, especially if you take the food to go.  The women working the front are absent and surly.  The place is no inviting or comfortable and looks drab and bare bones.  I get my sandwiches to go.  They are delicious and the BEST mufflattas outside of NOLA.  The marinated butter beans are amazing but they are ALWAYS out of stock

detailedReviews.author: Elizabeth Chubbuck
detailedReviews.text: Excellent flatbread pizza and Italian sandwiches! Friendly service, accurate order. Definitely worth a visit!

detailedReviews.author: Lori Flynn
detailedReviews.text: The BEST Mufflatta outside of NOLA!  The place is funky and not a place to really sit and eat.  It is BARE bones collection of a few odds and ends tables.  Service is nonexistent.  You order from the counter when someone shows up after a long wait.  Most people get a sandwich to go.

detailedReviews.author: Rachel Jensen
detailedReviews.text: We ordered hot sandwiches from Baldarotta's early this evening, and dined at home while viewing a film. The food was delicious. Both of our sandwiches were delectable, and my husband added side orders that he also enjoyed. We will most certainly be repeating this indulgence.

detailedReviews.author: Jonathan Allison
detailedReviews.text: Guys it‚Äôs really good trust me. Very balanced sandwiches

detailedReviews.author: Louie
detailedReviews.text:
This is certainly a great find, the "Diamond in the Rough"as it is said. I found this place on Google, had good reviews, and they're spot on.  I was in Urbana IL. for work purposes from Chicago,  being Italian, I had to try it. The food, service, atmosphere, and EXTREME FRIENDLY CUSTOMER SERVICE was well
above and beyond, more importantly the food was nothing short of spectacular. My only complaint is that they are so far away from Chicago, hopefully my work will bring me back to Champaign/Urban very soon, I would bring a cooler with ice to bring back some of their fresh / homemade Italian Sausage and other food products they offer.
Have the Porketta Sandwich.

detailedReviews.author: Joe F
detailedReviews.text: The sandwiches were delicious. I ordered The Baldarotta. The lemon pecorino fries were also very good! We will be back again.

detailedReviews.author: Jeffry Royce
detailedReviews.text: One of the best sandwiches in Champaign, hands down. Folks who come to visit me say they wake up weeks later randomly dreaming about the meal they had at Baldarotta's lol.

detailedReviews.author: SHEPHERD MEGAN EILEEN
detailedReviews.text: I wish I discovered this place sooner.

detailedReviews.author: Travis Gratzer
detailedReviews.text: Came here during the REO reunion....AAhhmazing and Incredible taste...sandwiches were out of control and the loaded pork friesü§§...everyone needs to run not walk to this place....except you'll be crawling when you're done...keep it going Baldarotta's, nothing short of delicious!

detailedReviews.author: PoppyBro
detailedReviews.text: Absolutely one of my favorite places to eat around town. A little pricey, but absolutely delicious sandwiches and special fries.

detailedReviews.author: Christine Allen
detailedReviews.text: I‚Äôve tried many of the hot and cold sandwiches on the menu. All of them are well made with quality ingredients but I keep coming back to my favorite, the Porketta, as the One That Satisfies Most. Everything here is wonderfully made, from the sides to the gelato which is worth a visit in and of itself - the flavors change daily.

detailedReviews.author: Dawn Steiner
detailedReviews.text: We got the Porketta, the Scicilian sausage, the Guido and a side of Caprese salad. It was all DELICIOUSLY AWESOME!

detailedReviews.author: Cory Easter
detailedReviews.text: The goodfella is a damn good sandwich! All the food is excellent and fresh! A Must Try!

detailedReviews.author: Leslie LeMoine
detailedReviews.text: Just love!!

detailedReviews.author: Rachel Yang
detailedReviews.text: Definitely the BEST sandwich in town. I have tried the Della and Pesto Ham. The flavor was spot on. The bread itself was herby and had a nice chew. The portion is great for the price

detailedReviews.author: Tony B
detailedReviews.text:
Take it from me. I know Italian sausage sandwiches. We grew up on these things. The key is keeping it simple. Peasant style.  A good sausage made with lots of garlic ,maybe fennel, black pepper, then red wine mixed in. Grilled peppers and onions.
Also in Italy or Sicily NO ONE puts marinara sauce on a sandwich let lone uses meatballs . No way an Italian made that up...lol)

detailedReviews.author: Zach Solecki
detailedReviews.text: These are not only the best sandwiches in Urbana, maybe the best sandwiches I‚Äôve ever had and likely the possibly the best restaurant of any kind in CU. What a treasure this place is. Support businesses like this as much as possible.

detailedReviews.author: Remy T
detailedReviews.text: Ordered food months ago and now I'm getting unrequested spam SMS ads from them.

detailedReviews.author: Kristen Pelz
detailedReviews.text: Delicious sandwiches

detailedReviews.author: josh richardson
detailedReviews.text: I got the guido which was great, but my wife got the ‚Äúworkman‚Äù and it was the best sandwich I‚Äôve ever had in my life. I‚Äôve been to a bunch of little Italian delis in St. Louis‚Äô ‚ÄúThe Hill‚Äù but this sandwich beat them all.

detailedReviews.author: Kathleen McGowan
detailedReviews.text: Love the salami & artichoke sandwich.

detailedReviews.author: Zhi Dou
detailedReviews.text: Very casual spot serving great sandwiches but definitely comes with a premium price tag.

detailedReviews.author: Howz
detailedReviews.text: Best sandwich I‚Äôve ever had! Especially the proketta sandwich, highly recommend. However, the waiting time has always been an issue for years. Every time I order online and come to pick up at the time shown on the order receipt, it always takes me at lease another 10-15 minites to wait in the shop. If I have to wait that long all the time, what‚Äôs the point of having me ordering online and showing me a pick-up time 15 minutes different from whatever the real pick up time it really is??? Really love the food so hopefully you can solve the problem in the future.

detailedReviews.author: Marcos Asse
detailedReviews.text: Bomb sandwich!  Everything made from scratch they tell me....it tastes like it.  I might call this the best hot sandwich in town.  Different fry options that are really, really good.

detailedReviews.author: Stephanie Yang
detailedReviews.text: Super yummy! The cold cut classic was a great and flavorful sandwich. My friends also enjoyed the parmesan chicken sandwich. The pickles were a nice touch but a little more sour than some expected.

detailedReviews.author: Monica Ram√≠rez
detailedReviews.text: Love it!!!!

detailedReviews.author: Dustin Coffey
detailedReviews.text: The place was terrible. The lady at the register was completely rude for no reason they screwed up. They charged my card and then tried to charge me extra on my card. Never will be back again place as a joke.

detailedReviews.author: Roger Burt
detailedReviews.text:
Pros:
Best sandwiches in the area. Their namesake and the Goodfella are incredible, as is the italian beef (best in town - get it with hot sausage) and the porketta. Fries have been reformulated since the move from Lincoln square. They are aggressively seasoned and offered with your choice of a selection of house-made condiments, all of which are delicious. Try the red pepper ketchup even if (like me) you are not a ketchup person. The Tuesday special Agglassato is like an italian-ized roast beef sandwich. It's comfort on a french roll.

Cons:
If you eat an entire sandwich, you may experience an unscheduled nap. Worth it.
They're not open on Mondays.

Get food here. They are awesome.

detailedReviews.author: Jonathan Wang
detailedReviews.text:
The Della, Caprese, and Garden are personal favorites

porketta, though very good, was quite greasy

detailedReviews.author: Hugh Robertson
detailedReviews.text: Grilled the spicy sausage, probably the best sausage I have had. So much flavour! Melted in my mouth.

detailedReviews.author: Megan Lamb
detailedReviews.text: Not from the area. Went last night with 5 other people on a recommendation from a local. Got the Baldarotta, the Goodfella, the Chicken Parmesan, and the Pesto Grilled Cheese. Also tried some gelato and sorbet. Everything was outstanding. Bread, meats, garnishes all absolutely delicious. We hope to go back next time we are in town.

detailedReviews.author: JF Bruns
detailedReviews.text: First time here, not from the area & it took a bit to figure out where to park - in back.  We each had different sandwiches, 1 chips, 2 drinks: $41.  Both were signature sandwiches & both were very good.  Drinks are can/bottle from the cooler so no refills. Overall, the food outweighed the negatives for 5 stars.

detailedReviews.author: Thomas Wilsey
detailedReviews.text: Super chill and great food

detailedReviews.author: Colleen Lamb
detailedReviews.text: Delicious! Delicious! Delicious! The Porketta was so tender and flavorful and the Sicilian Sausage was perfect! The canoli was the best I've had in decades since growing up in Chicago! The salads when walking in look amazing and I intend to try them all! (Added bonus is there is a brewery next door.)

detailedReviews.author: Amy Scrimpsher
detailedReviews.text: The food was wonderful and filling! Absolutely recommend! The lemon-pecorino fries were spot-on and the Basil-pesto tortellini is one of my favorites! My husband and I shared a porketta, a sicilian sausage, the tortellini, the fries, a coke. We also had a coupon! We had food left over to take home! So, good!

detailedReviews.author: Amy Barradas
detailedReviews.text: First time! Staff very helpful.   Had the Baldrotta sandwich. Hot, savory, and plentiful! Anti pasto(sp) delicious! Will be back.

detailedReviews.author: Jared Lamb
detailedReviews.text: This is a family run place where sandwiches are made with love! We ordered several of them and they were all fantastic. You're not going to find a menu like this anywhere in the area, so look it up online first and be sure you want a REAL sandwich. Personally, I do not really care for Italian sausage, but this place makes it in-house, and it is phenomenal! All of their sides are homemade, their Gelato is homemade, their canolis are homemade, their homemade is homeade! You need to go here! This will be a place we regularly visit when we are in Champaign/Urbana. Side-note: There is a brewery (25 O'Clock Brewing) next door that Baldarotta's has a little snack menu at. If you check their hours. Grab a sandwich, grab a beer, and have a great meal.

detailedReviews.author: Adam Campbell
detailedReviews.text: The new location is great. The food is incredible.

detailedReviews.author: Kelli Brewer
detailedReviews.text: Always a great experience with even better food!

detailedReviews.author: Ben Gault
detailedReviews.text: Amazing authentic sandwiches. I've tried the porcetta and the Italian beef and both were amazing. Big enough to share or take home. My advice is to try them the way they make them because the flavors all work really well together. Yum.

detailedReviews.author: Chris Summitt
detailedReviews.text: Great food

detailedReviews.author: Vee Food Life
detailedReviews.text:
Meat sandos make me happy!

Glad we stopped by to try this spot! Literally everything was so delish!

We were greeted upon entry and although I briefly looked at the menu online, there‚Äôs so much other randomness that‚Äôs available!  Be sure to follow their socials for specials and limited menu items that aren‚Äôt on the paper menus at the counter.

We ordered the Baldarotta, Italian Beef, and Turkey Pesto-Hot.  Also got an order of fries and the Sicilian Potato Salad. Then ran away with 2 pistachio cannolis!

There are quite a few tables in the dining area. I really enjoyed that each table was different with a different set of chairs for each table.  There are restrooms available‚Ä¶which was great because I definitely got messy!

The namesake Baldarotta had a combination of the porketta and sausage and it made me smile from ear to ear! Such a comforting sandwich.  The Italian Beef came with a a whole wide container of au jus for optimal dipping and was so flavorful!  The Turkey pesto ordered hot (vs. cold) is a game changer! The pesto Mayo was DELISH!  Fries were well seasoned.  The potato salad had olives in it and I enjoyed that as well! The cannolis we took to go and enjoyed them later that evening! I loved how it wasn‚Äôt too sweet at all!

Parking was easy as there are spaces in the back. They are next to a brewery so could see pairing these tasty eats with a drink or two next door.

Will definitely be back!

detailedReviews.author: Robert Lamb
detailedReviews.text:
My son found this place.  What a gem! They serve Sicilian Deli sandwiches here that are outstanding. I had the Porketta sandwich with tender slices of pork loin marinated and piled high with baby spinach leaves and pepper salad. It was great. My wife had the Sicilian Sausage sandwich with a spicy red sauce. My son tried the Baldorata, which was a combo of both, and the Muffaletta sandwich made with real Pistachio Mortadella. It will be my place in Champaign.
Another plus is the 25 O'clock brewery right next door!! They serve an eclectic variety of beers, with homemade ginger ale for the kiddies. Benches and board games, free pool and darts, and you can order any food from Baldarotta's next door, and they will deliver it to for free. Great Combo spot for great food and great beer.
Located just east of route 45. On Griggs street, a block south of University Drive.

detailedReviews.author: Joe Pasta
detailedReviews.text: Great food but $18 for the sandwich is pretty insane, dont see myself here as often as id like because of this. Definitely worth trying if you have not though. If they lower proces i bet theyd get more business.

detailedReviews.author: Scott Wessel
detailedReviews.text: We ate here two days in a row. The food is simply phenomenal! You have to give it a try.

detailedReviews.author: Kim Bode
detailedReviews.text: Food was great! So glad we tried it! Will definitely return!

detailedReviews.author: Yunu√©n Arroyo
detailedReviews.text: The sandwiches are delicious. I ordered the chicken parmesan. The sauce tasted homemade, the chicken had the perfect seasoning. One of the best in places for Italian food.

detailedReviews.author: Aanan Kashyap
detailedReviews.text: Food was really good, not too pricey, and came out quickly. Staff was friendly and welcoming.

detailedReviews.author: Angela B-Fletcher
detailedReviews.text: This our first time eating at Baldarotta's. The host were friendly and the establishment atmosphere were welcoming. On my next visit I will order the Porketta at the host suggestion. Definitely 5 stars

detailedReviews.author: James Lee
detailedReviews.text: I go to champaign urbana a few times a year from chicago and always looking for something to eat before I come back home. I was craving a good sandwich and this place has freakin good sandwiches. I got the Porketta and italian beef. the italian beef was solid. the Porketta was so good. probably one of the best sandwiches I've had. really! I saved half to give to my wife and she was super impressed as well. she wished she could have had it fresh. coming back for sure

detailedReviews.author: Billy Davidson
detailedReviews.text: The Good Stuff in Life!

detailedReviews.author: Katherine Stoelinga
detailedReviews.text: Most incredible sandwiches ever!!! Highly recommend to anyone looking for a delicious meal and a cozy atmosphere.

detailedReviews.author: DANISH THAMEEM (DT)
detailedReviews.text:
best Italian beef sandwich
The gelato is great too

detailedReviews.author: Terry Kirts
detailedReviews.text: Excellent sandwiches in a funky brewery building. A must on a stop to CU!

detailedReviews.author: Casey Diana
detailedReviews.text: Best meatball sandwiches EVER!  Better than New York!

detailedReviews.author: Avery Harres
detailedReviews.text: Awesome service, everything was super tasty 10/10!!!!

detailedReviews.author: Steve Kenmotsu
detailedReviews.text: It's a sandwich shop on the pricey side, but the sandwiches were good.

detailedReviews.author: Sofia
detailedReviews.text: This place reminds me of the Italian delis I grew up going to around the Chicago suburbs. C-U has been missing a good classic Italian deli like this! Tasty food and generous portions, I‚Äôve been back twice so far and will continue to come in and try the specials.

detailedReviews.author: Chris Cox
detailedReviews.text: Awesome sandwiches!

detailedReviews.author: Pj Clingenpeel
detailedReviews.text: The best sandwich and sides in the entire area! And canolis to die for!!!

detailedReviews.author: Camron Mills
detailedReviews.text: Enjoyed visiting the new place!

detailedReviews.author: James
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza in town easily. So so good. Love the sandwiches. Specially the chicken parm. Great staff and fair prices.

detailedReviews.author: rich wright
detailedReviews.text: Paris and Jordan have prepared our office Christmas party meal for several years. All of us love it, always great! It's an employee favorite for lunch too. Highly recommend!!

detailedReviews.author: John Craig
detailedReviews.text: Of the beaten path but well worth it. Some of the best and most original sandwiches in town.

detailedReviews.author: Sir Kiddo
detailedReviews.text: A lovely little Italian deli and sandwich shop, their new location has not changed their quality in any way

detailedReviews.author: Michelle Headrick
detailedReviews.text:
After today's experience at Baldarotta's Porketta & Sicilian Sausage we will never be going back. The level of unprofessionalism and discrimination exhibited by one of their owners was astonishing.

To give a brief synopsis we were excited to try out their new location for lunch. We were immediately met with rudeness for no apparent reason by the woman at the counter, I later learned she was actually one of the owners. I honestly just brushed it off and didn't think too much into it at first. But that changed the moment we said we would be eating there and she stepped out from the counter and said "I'm going to stick you guys in here." as she turned on the light to the extra dining room. For context there's maybe 15 tables in their main dining room and two or three of them had customers. Additionally, this was around 11:30 am and there were no customers behind us in line. The extra dining room was dirty and had food on the floor and the tables needed cleaned. The couple that had been in front of us got great customer service and the woman was very pleasant with them. It became very apparent that we were being treated differently due to the dog, who is a trained service dog being with us. We decided to ask for our money back and leave even though we love their food and have been looking forward to it. When we walked back into the main room and asked if we could cancel our order and be refunded the response we received was absolutely in a harsh tone. She gave me my cash back and I said thank you. She responded by ignoring me and acting as if I was invisible.

We walked around the building to the parking lot and I told my husband that I couldn't leave without having a conversation with her because the entire interaction just did not sit well with me. I walked back in and patiently waited for a couple at the counter to finish ordering. It should be noted the light to the other dining area we were told to go sit in was off again. Again when I approached I received a cold response after witnessing her being very pleasant with the couple in front of me. I asked if I could speak with a manager or someone in charge. That is when she informed me that it was her and she was a part owner.  I asked her why she has been so rude towards us and that we felt discriminated against because of our service dog. She told me she didn't see anything stating he was a service dog. I explained ADA law does not require a service animal to be vested and that she never asked if he was or even mentioned dogs were not allowed, had she asked or said something we would have informed her he was. I would also like to note that the majority of our interaction with her the dog was sitting or in a down stay not causing any issues. She admitted that she did treat us differently because of the dog and said she could have handled the situation better but never actually took accountability or apologized for the entire situation.

I'm sorry for the long read but I truly couldn't stay quiet about this. I hope she learned something from this interaction today and as much as I'm saddened and disappointed in the entire situation I'm honestly glad it happened to us and not someone who is not able to speak up for themselves. I truly hope they decide to do some self reflecting and learn how to be more accommodating for individuals with disabilities in the future.

detailedReviews.author: Josh D
detailedReviews.text: Love the variety in sandwiches and house made fries. Cant go wrong with the chicken parm, Italian beef or porketta.

detailedReviews.author: A. Mxy
detailedReviews.text: Love this place.  Glad they have their own building now.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers are genuinely thrilled with their experience. With an average 4.7/5 rating across 100 recent reviews, your restaurant consistently exceeds expectations.

strengthsPerceived: Customers rave about the delicious and artisanal quality of the sandwiches, particularly highlighting the porketta and muffaletta as standout options. - social media marketing can showcase this strength

improvementOpportunities: Poor customer service and negative interactions with staff - review management can address this concern
Long wait times for online orders - Boostly marketing services can improve this
Lack of inviting atmosphere and ambiance - social media marketing can improve this area

positive.author: Matthew Hiser
positive.text: Best sandwiches in CU by a mile. This is the one place I don't have a "usual" order. Everything I've had has been delicious.

neutral.text: Best sandwich I‚Äôve ever had! Especially the proketta sandwich, highly recommend. However, the waiting time has always been an issue for years. Every time I order online and come to pick up at the time shown on the order receipt, it always takes me at lease another 10-15 minites to wait in the shop. If I have to wait that long all the time, what‚Äôs the point of having me ordering online and showing me a pick-up time 15 minutes different from whatever the real pick up time it really is??? Really love the food so hopefully you can solve the problem in the future.

neutral.author: Joe Pasta
neutral.text: Great food but $18 for the sandwich is pretty insane, dont see myself here as often as id like because of this. Definitely worth trying if you have not though. If they lower proces i bet theyd get more business.

negative.text: Ordered food months ago and now I'm getting unrequested spam SMS ads from them.

negative.author: Dustin Coffey
negative.text: The place was terrible. The lady at the register was completely rude for no reason they screwed up. They charged my card and then tried to charge me extra on my card. Never will be back again place as a joke.

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
